1. Calculate the total home team scores by summing up all the values in the 'Home Team Score' column. This involves adding 14.7, 16.14, 13.12, 20.8, 19.14, and 10.13.

2. Count the number of rows (i.e., instances) in the table to find out how many times we summed up a home team score in step 1. In this case, there are 6 rows with home team scores.

3. Divide the total home team score calculated in step 1 by the count of rows obtained in step 2 to find the average home team score. This will give us an approximate number representing the average of all the home team scores in the table.

4. Compare the calculated average (from step 3) with the desired threshold value of 12. If the average is less than 12, then the claim is true; otherwise, it is false.
